content.description: Unknown climb to the left of "Still Smokin" and to the right of "Fiyo".  Climbs on the right side of the left most black streak.  Wasn't listed in mountain project when I went on October 8, 2018, so hopefully somebody will post this route.
content.location: It is on the right side of the left most black streak on the Fire wall.  It is definitely right of the 5.12a Hammer Time and left of the 5.10d Still Smokin.  I believe the 5.11d Fiyo goes right up the middle of the streak, and the unknown route goes up the right side of the streak.

content.description: Another nice climb. Bouldery crux up high with a big pull over the final roof.
content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchors with biners
content.location: Blonde streak left of right most black streak; left of Firewalker.

content.description: Climb over bulges.  One long reach
content.location: Start by dead tree; just left of Reignite

content.description: Fun sustained 5.7. This is one of the easiest climbs on the wall and the anchors are in a great spot to set up a toprope after climbing it.
content.location: To the right of In Descent

climbs.name: Reignite
climbs.fa: Dan Greenwald, Jay Foley & GinKevin Ormerod

content.protection: 7 bolts to chain anchors with one locking biner, one steel biner (October 2016)
content.location: Left of the middle black streak; left of Burnt

content.description: Great route with nice movement and face climbing.
content.protection: 7 or so bolts to chain anchor

content.description: Good warm-up on steep face with a bulge. Move left before bulge and back right.
content.protection: 7 or so bolts and chain anchors
content.location: The right-most bolted route on the main wall.

content.description: A fun warm up on left side of Fire Wall. For 5.9 grade Stay right of bolts as the route steepens about halfway or Stay left here and earn 5.10+.
content.protection: 9 Bolts to chain anchors with biners
content.location: Left side of Fire Wall up the right side of taller orange wall left of bushy "gully".

content.description: Really fun route between The Anvil and FYIO, with a fun and committing crux going to the last bolt.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors.  May want to stick clip the first bolt.

climbs.name: Flashback
climbs.fa: Dan Greenwald, Jay Foley, et al

content.description: Named after the 1990 adventure comedy film starring Dennis Hopper.  Take a "trip" up this meandering route.  Climb the DHMR's optional 5.9 bolted start to a ledge.  From the ledge, clip a bolt and reach left to a crack with great side pulls until it is possible to clip the next bolt and traverse right.  Continue up with a reachy crux at the last bolt.  Shorter people may find it easier to climb a bit left at the crux.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with chains and steel carabiners.
content.location: Start just left of In Descent on the DHMR's optional 5.9 bolted start.

content.description:
This route climbs over several bulges along the left black streak. There are some good distances between some of the bolts but the climbing is generally easier during the gaps. Many of the holds can be difficult to find if not well chalked, be sure to feel around in the horizontals to find the best spots. 

  Grab some jugs and reach high to make the first clip. The hardest moves are just above getting to the second bolt. Continue up the water streak turning a few more bulges along the way.
content.location: This route is on the Fire Wall (upper) and climbs the left hand of the 3 black streaks.

climbs.name: Fire Walker
climbs.fa: Spike Lynch, Jay Foley & Dan Greenwald

content.description:
Quality climb with great movement.  

  [Admin's note: Originally a TR-only line and previously described on Mountain Project as such by LeeAB Brinckerhoff:  Repetitive climbing up horizontal edges along the right hand black streak. A little harder getting to and moving through the roof at 2/3 height. This is listed as a TR in the JFoley guide book.]
content.protection: 7 or so bolts to chain anchors.
content.location: On the right side of the right most black streak.  Left of The Egg.

content.protection: 8 or so bolts and chain anchors
content.location: Third route from the right; left of Prescribed Burn

content.description: Bouldery start to high first bolt. Try to stay on bolt line, harder to right easier to the left. A little reachy at the crux. Easy finish on left side of arete. Easy top rope route to left.
content.location: about 20 ft to left of Dennis Hopper Memorial Route

climbs.name: Dennis Hopper Memorial Route
climbs.fa: J Foley, Tim Naylor, Ted O'maley. Memorial Day 2010

content.description: Start directly behind tree and follow a small right facing corner up fifteen feet then traverse right under small  roof and climb face to corner at ledge. Now follow A double crack system caped by small roof above. Exit left around roof then continue up crack above. Good pro up to the roof. Marginal shallow pro immediately before and after roof then decent pro to a two bolt anchor. There is an optional 5.9+ bolted start to the right.
content.protection: Standard rack. This is the only trad route on the fire wall.
content.location: Left side of Fire Wall. About 8 feet left of In Descent

content.description: Crimpy and steep.  Nice sidepulls.  Some say its the hardest route on the wall due to sustained nature.  Great crux at the roof.
content.protection: 8 bolts to chain anchors with biners
content.location: Goes up black streak in middle of firewall. Lower off 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: Climb up over bulge and then up to hanging anvil.
content.location: Start 15 feet left of leftmost black streak (Fiyo).

content.description: This is a nice west facing wall that sits directly above Water Wall. The Fire Wall itself catches tons of afternoon sun as there is a lack of living trees on the bench above Water Wall. The routes up here are mostly sport climbs.
